Q2. In DPV, the plot is obtained by plotting:

answers.a: Potential difference as a function of current.
answers.b: Potential difference as a function of time.
answers.c: Current difference as a function of time.
answers.d: Current difference as a function of potential.

questions.question: Q3. Which of the following is a disadvantage of dropping the mercury electrode (DME)?

answers.a: Applied voltage produces changes in surface tension and hence a change in drop size.
answers.b: Mercury has a high hydrogen overvoltage.
answers.c: It provides a smooth, fresh surface for the reaction.
answers.d: Mercury forms an amalgam with most metals.

questions.question: Q4. Which of the following statement is true?

answers.a: A reference electrode is not required for a cell used for a voltammetry experiment.
answers.b: The diffusion layer is found further away from the surface over time diffusion occurs.
answers.c: Migration cannot be prevented through the addition of a supporting electrolyte with high ionic strength.
answers.d: Diffusion of ions near the electrode surface reduces the concentration profile near the electrode over time for the analyte that is consumed in the electrochemical reaction.

Q7. From the following, select the incorrect statement about DPV.

answers.a: The height of the peak current is directly proportional to the analyte concentration.
answers.b: The detection limit lies between 10 <sup>-7</sup> to 10 <sup>-8</sup> M.

questions.question: Q8. A half-wave potential is a tool for ____________

answers.b: Study of the half-life of electroactive species.
answers.c: Determination of concentration of electroactive species.
